message.content: Metonymy is a figure of speech in which one word or phrase is substituted for another with which it is closely associated, often as a part for the whole. For example, "The White House" can be used to refer to the U.S. government or administration, and "Hollywood" can be used to refer to the American film industry. Metonyms are commonly used in everyday language and literature to create vivid images or to add emphasis to a statement.
